description: 1772, UK, probably alteration of French taïaut (interjection used in deer-hunting), from Middle French tahou, tayo, from Old French taho, ta ho, tielau (interjection given to hounds to return) (second half of 13th century), composed of ta (particle used to prod animals) + ho ! (“halt!, hold!”). More at ho.

examples: Alright, I'll give them the old tallyho.
They could not come to-day; there would have been hardly room for them in the tallyho.

verbs.description: tallyho (third-person singular simple present tallyhos, present participle tallyhoing, simple past and past participle tallyhoed)

examples: I'll tallyho once we've got to the top.
